condition.description:
An arrhythmia is a problem with the rate or rhythm of your heartbeat. It means that your heart beats too quickly, too slowly, or with an irregular pattern. When the heart beats faster than normal, it is called tachycardia. When the heart beats too slowly, it is called bradycardia. The most common type of arrhythmia is atrial fibrillation, which causes an irregular and fast heart beat.

Many factors can affect your heart's rhythm, such as having had a heart attack, smoking, congenital heart defects, and stress. Some substances or medicines may also cause arrhythmias.

Symptoms of arrhythmias include

  • Fast or slow heart beat
  • Skipping beats
  • Lightheadedness or dizziness
  • Chest pain
  • Shortness of breath
  • Sweating

Your doctor can run tests to find out if you have an arrhythmia. Treatment to restore a normal heart rhythm may include medicines, an implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) or pacemaker, or sometimes surgery.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
indications: abnormal heart rhythm prevention and treatment
condition.name: Arrhythmia

indications: Abnormal heart rhythm prevention and treatment

carousel_items: Your doctor may have you start taking Amiodarone in a hospital or clinic so you can be watched closely for side effects.
It can take 1 or 2 weeks before you start to see any effects.
There are many serious side effects that can only be found by getting blood tests done. It's important to follow all of your doctor's instructions when taking Amiodarone.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun. Use proper protection, such as sunscreen, and avoid sun lamps.
Can cause nausea, so you can take it with food to help.
Drinking grapefruit juice with Amiodarone can affect your heart rate, so avoid all forms of grapefruits.

basics.benefits_moa: Amiodarone is an anti-arrhythmic medicine. It treats heart rate problems by blocking rogue electrical signals in your heart.
basics.bottom_line: Amiodarone is an option to treat heart rate problems when other medicines don't work, but it can take a few weeks to work and there's a lot of serious side effects.
downsides: Not a good choice if you have eye, liver, or lung problems.
You'll need regular monitoring for side effects, such as routine blood tests, heart tests, and eye exams.
Amiodarone can stay in your body for weeks or months after you've stopped taking it. Make sure you tell your doctor or dentist that you've taken Amiodarone if they don't already know.
There are many possible drug interactions, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before making any changes or starting a new medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a good choice if you have eye, liver, or lung problems.
You'll need regular monitoring for side effects, such as routine blood tests, heart tests, and eye exams.
Amiodarone can stay in your body for weeks or months after you've stopped taking it. Make sure you tell your doctor or dentist that you've taken Amiodarone if they don't already know.
There are many possible drug interactions, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before making any changes or starting a new medicine.

upsides: An option for treating life-threatening heart rate problems when other medicines or procedures haven't worked.
Amiodarone has been shown to lower the number of heart rate problems you can experience after certain types of heart surgeries.
Available as a generic version, so it should be affordable.

upsides_processed.orig: An option for treating life-threatening heart rate problems when other medicines or procedures haven't worked.
Amiodarone has been shown to lower the number of heart rate problems you can experience after certain types of heart surgeries.
Available as a generic version, so it should be affordable.

userStories.tip: Take the loading dose (several weeks) alone so if you vomit 20 minutes later, you only lose one drug, not your entire regimen. 800mg is hard for me to keep down. Maintenance dose (after 2 weeks) is a piece of cake.

drugs.name: Amiodarone

carousel_items_processed.orig: Your doctor may have you start taking Amiodarone in a hospital or clinic so you can be watched closely for side effects.
It can take 1 or 2 weeks before you start to see any effects.
There are many serious side effects that can only be found by getting blood tests done. It's important to follow all of your doctor's instructions when taking Amiodarone.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun. Use proper protection, such as sunscreen, and avoid sun lamps.
Can cause nausea, so you can take it with food to help.
Drinking grapefruit juice with Amiodarone can affect your heart rate, so avoid all forms of grapefruits.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatening heart rate problems
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone should only be used in people with life-threatening heart rate problems. There are many potentially fatal side effects and it can make the heart rate problem worse or harder to handle. Other similar medicines should be tried first before Amiodarone. People can start taking Amiodarone in a hospital to watch for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone should only be used in people with life-threatening heart rate problems. There are many potentially fatal side effects and it can make the heart rate problem worse or harder to handle. Other similar medicines should be tried first before Amiodarone. People can start taking Amiodarone in a hospital to watch for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Lung damage
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause serious lung problems, sometimes without any symptoms. Call your doctor immediately if you have any breathing problems, like shortness of breath, trouble breathing, or a cough. Baseline and follow-up lab tests, including chest x-rays every 3 to 6 months, are needed before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause serious lung problems, sometimes without any symptoms. Call your doctor immediately if you have any breathing problems, like shortness of breath, trouble breathing, or a cough. Baseline and follow-up lab tests, including chest x-rays every 3 to 6 months, are needed before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone is broken down by the liver. It can cause mild liver problems, but in some cases, it can cause severe problems. Call your doctor immediately if you have dark urine or light-colored stool, yellow skin or eyes, stomach pain, or feel tired or not hungry. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone is broken down by the liver. It can cause mild liver problems, but in some cases, it can cause severe problems. Call your doctor immediately if you have dark urine or light-colored stool, yellow skin or eyes, stomach pain, or feel tired or not hungry. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Vision problems
risks_warnings.description: Vision problems, such as blurred vision, decreased peripheral vision, or visual halos, can occur. Talk to your doctor if you experience any vision impairment and make sure you have regular eye exams every 6 months.

description_processed.orig: Vision problems, such as blurred vision, decreased peripheral vision, or visual halos, can occur. Talk to your doctor if you experience any vision impairment and make sure you have regular eye exams every 6 months.

risks_warnings.title: Thyroid problems
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause low or high levels of thyroid hormone. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of thyroid problems or are taking thyroid medicine. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed every 6 months before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause low or high levels of thyroid hormone. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of thyroid problems or are taking thyroid medicine. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed every 6 months before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause birth defects. Don't use Amiodarone while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause birth defects. Don't use Amiodarone while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Interacts with grapefruit and the cholesterol medicine Simvastatin.
Can cause constipation and headache.
Don't drink too much alcohol while taking this medicine.
Your doctor might do routine blood tests to check your liver function.

basics.benefits_moa: Verapamil is a calcium channel blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing your heart rate and relaxing your blood vessels. Your heart gets more oxygen and doesn't have to work as hard to pump, which can relieve chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Verapamil works well to lower blood pressure and prevent chest pain, but you have to be okay with avoiding alcohol. You can't miss doses, and you might get persistent swelling.
downsides: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Verapamil than men.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Verapamil suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Not a good medication for you if you drink alcohol.

downsides_processed.orig: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Verapamil than men.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Verapamil suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Not a good medication for you if you drink alcohol.

upsides: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.
Calcium channel blockers work especially well for African Americans to lower blood pressure.
You can take it alone or with other medicines to help lower blood pressure.
Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Prevents heart-related chest pain (angina) if you take it regularly.
Treats certain abnormal heart rhythms.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice blood pressure treatment for many people.

Treats certain abnormal heart rhythms.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Reports of heart failure or pulmonary edema (increased fluid in the lungs) have been reported. If your doctor feels that Verapamil will work for you, they will work with you to control the issues with your heart before starting Verapamil.

description_processed.orig: Reports of heart failure or pulmonary edema (increased fluid in the lungs) have been reported. If your doctor feels that Verapamil will work for you, they will work with you to control the issues with your heart before starting Verapamil.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may experience sudden drops in blood pressure while on Verapamil, which may cause dizziness. Be careful when getting up from either a seated or lying down position to prevent falls.

description_processed.orig: You may experience sudden drops in blood pressure while on Verapamil, which may cause dizziness. Be careful when getting up from either a seated or lying down position to prevent falls.

risks_warnings.title: Elevated liver enzymes
risks_warnings.description: Your doctor may check your liver regularly, as there have been reports of liver damage which can only be seen through blood tests. If you do have a history of liver disease, let your doctor know.

description_processed.orig: Your doctor may check your liver regularly, as there have been reports of liver damage which can only be seen through blood tests. If you do have a history of liver disease, let your doctor know.

risks_warnings.title: Heart rhythm problems
risks_warnings.description: Your doctor may monitor your heart to see if changes to its electrical system may occur, especially if you have had liver or kidney disease in the past.

description_processed.orig: Your doctor may monitor your heart to see if changes to its electrical system may occur, especially if you have had liver or kidney disease in the past.

basics.benefits_moa: Diltiazem is a calcium channel blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing your heart rate and relaxing your blood vessels. Your heart gets more oxygen and doesn't have to work as hard to pump, which can relieve chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Diltiazem works well to lower blood pressure and prevent chest pain, but you have to be okay with avoiding alcohol. You can't miss doses, and you might get persistent swelling.
downsides: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.

You can't miss doses. Stopping Diltiazem suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

risks_warnings.title: Skin rashes
risks_warnings.description: There have been rare reports of serious up to life-threatening skin rashes in patients who have taken Diltiazem. If you notice a sudden severe rash, tell your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: There have been rare reports of serious up to life-threatening skin rashes in patients who have taken Diltiazem. If you notice a sudden severe rash, tell your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormally slow heart rate
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you are on digoxin or beta-blockers, as this may cause increased slowing of your heart rate.
risk_factors: Taking digoxin or beta-blockers at the same time

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know if you are on digoxin or beta-blockers, as this may cause increased slowing of your heart rate.

risks_warnings.title: Sudden liver disease
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of liver damage within the first eight weeks of Diltiazem, particularly if you have a history of liver disease. Your doctor may monitor your liver.

basics.benefits_moa: Propranolol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Propranolol is good for treating many heart problems and other problems in the body, but it has more side effects than other beta blockers. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).

userStories.tip: Nausea, dizziness and loss of energy.
I actually take it for essential tremor. It works very well. My hands no longer shake which is great.
The worst side effects for me...threw me into a deep depression. Horrendous.
I take it for occasional stage fright.

I've used it for public speaking, it works great totally stops irrriating hand or voice shakes. However; I experienced sudden dizziness after getting up quickly after a period of long period of sitting.
took this to manage shakes from lithium. it worked pretty well.

no issue; take as low of a dose as possible, remember to not skip doses, and prepare for a day when you don't need to take it any longer. completely stopped my anxiety from lasting more than a couple of minutes.
I started taking it for migraine prevention, but then found it completely rid me of my stage fright and issues with public speaking.
I'm taking very short amounts for anxiety since my doctor wants me to calm down but doesn't want to give me any drug that would mess up with my brain. It's working great!
Take it only when you need. It reduces the physical symptoms of anxiety, such as sweating, but it does not help with the mental aspect of anxiety

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause insomnia and fatigue.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased chest pain or risk of heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

description_processed.orig: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers, digoxin or clonidine

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rare reports of skin rash have been reported which may be considered serious to life-threatening. If you notice a sudden severe skin rash with a fever, call your doctor immediately.

basics.benefits_moa: Atenolol is a selective beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart and making it less work to pump.
basics.bottom_line: Atenolol is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack with fewer side effects than other beta blockers. You have to take it on an empty stomach, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: You have to take Atenolol on an empty stomach.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Atenolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take Atenolol on an empty stomach.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Atenolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
At lower doses, Atenolol has fewer side effects than most beta blockers because it targets the heart and doesn't cross into the brain and central nervous system.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or increased chest pain
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without consulting your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, as chest pain or angina may become increased or it may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without consulting your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, as chest pain or angina may become increased or it may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people developing heart failure while taking Atenolol. If you notice swelling in your feet or ankles, or if your pulse feels fast or irregular, or shortness of breath when you lie down or during exercise, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people developing heart failure while taking Atenolol. If you notice swelling in your feet or ankles, or if your pulse feels fast or irregular, or shortness of breath when you lie down or during exercise, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing of the heart rate
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication, especially if you take other medications to slow your heart rate such as calcium channel blockers. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication, especially if you take other medications to slow your heart rate such as calcium channel blockers. risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Atenolol, so that they will be aware to monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Atenolol, so that they will be aware to monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Atenolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Atenolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Atenolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Atenolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Atenolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Atenolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of rebound high blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly if you are also taking clonidine as this may cause a rebound in your blood pressure. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly if you are also taking clonidine as this may cause a rebound in your blood pressure. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

points.name: Cold Extremities
points.hlt: peripheral vasoconstriction, necrosis and vascular insufficiency

points.name: Leg Pain
points.hlt: musculoskeletal and connective tissue pain and discomfort

carousel_items: Take it with food.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and erectile dysfunction.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

clock.tip: Take with food to lower the chance of getting head rush.

basics.benefits_moa: Carvedilol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Carvedilol is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: You have to take Carvedilol with food.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take Carvedilol with food.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
For people with severe heart failure, Carvedilol lowers the risk of worsening heart failure, hospitalization, and sudden death.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
For people with severe heart failure, Carvedilol lowers the risk of worsening heart failure, hospitalization, and sudden death.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: it's recommended to take it with food; it can cause swelling and weight gain.
I feel it has caused weight gain that I am unable to lose with diet and exercise.

heart rate went from in the 60's on atenolol to  90 to 100 bpm when cardiologist 
changed to coreg.

drugs.name: Coreg

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it with food.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and erectile dysfunction.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Worsened chest pain; increased risk of heart attack and heart rhythm problems
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly may start a heart attack or cause problems in your heartbeat rhythm. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Carvedilol suddenly may start a heart attack or cause problems in your heartbeat rhythm. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing of the heart rate
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose.

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may experience a sudden decrease in your blood pressure, which may cause dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

description_processed.orig: You may experience a sudden decrease in your blood pressure, which may cause dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening heart failure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice worsening symptoms of heart failure if your prescriber decides to increase your dosage of Carvedilol. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as they may make changes to your medications for heart failure.

description_processed.orig: You may notice worsening symptoms of heart failure if your prescriber decides to increase your dosage of Carvedilol. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as they may make changes to your medications for heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Carvedilol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Carvedilol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Carvedilol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Carvedilol.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Carvedilol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Carvedilol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Carvedilol who have overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Carvedilol who have overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Carvedilol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

carousel_items: Take it at the same time every day.
Drink plenty of water while taking this medicine.
Requires routine blood tests to make sure you have the right amount of Digoxin in your body.
Tell your doctor about other medicines you're taking to avoid drug interactions.

basics.benefits_moa: Digoxin helps your heart work more efficiently. It makes your heart pump slower and stronger, which helps it get more blood and oxygen out to your body and organs.
basics.bottom_line: Digoxin is a good backup for treating heart failure symptoms, but it doesn't, by itself, lower your risk of death.
downsides: For heart failure, relieves symptoms, but does not lower the risk of death. That's why it's usually used together with other heart failure medicines that do lower the risk of death.
Requires blood tests, especially during the first few weeks of treatment.

downsides_processed.orig: For heart failure, relieves symptoms, but does not lower the risk of death. That's why it's usually used together with other heart failure medicines that do lower the risk of death.
Requires blood tests, especially during the first few weeks of treatment.

upsides: Used for some abnormal heart rhythms, and for heart failure that can't be controlled by other medications.
Relieves shortness of breath, and makes it easier to be active without having symptoms.
In studies, Digoxin lowered the risk of having to be admitted to the hospital for worsening heart failure.

upsides_processed.orig: Used for some abnormal heart rhythms, and for heart failure that can't be controlled by other medications.
Relieves shortness of breath, and makes it easier to be active without having symptoms.
In studies, Digoxin lowered the risk of having to be admitted to the hospital for worsening heart failure.

userStories.tip: The recommended appropriate dosage is one tablet (125 mcg.) by oral route once daily.

drugs.name: Digoxin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it at the same time every day.
Drink plenty of water while taking this medicine.
Requires routine blood tests to make sure you have the right amount of Digoxin in your body.
Tell your doctor about other medicines you're taking to avoid drug interactions.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Digoxin can cause changes to your heartbeat (ventricular fibrillation) if you have a rare condition called Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome. Talk to your doctor if you have this condition.

description_processed.orig: Digoxin can cause changes to your heartbeat (ventricular fibrillation) if you have a rare condition called Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome. Talk to your doctor if you have this condition.

risks_warnings.title: Increased digoxin levels in the blood
risks_warnings.description: Digoxin can be harmful if too much is taken. Your prescriber will monitor your blood to make sure you have the correct amount in your body. If you or your caregivers/family notice nausea, vomiting, changes in vision or inability to eat, let your doctor know as soon as possible.
risk_factors: Low body weight, advanced age, impaired renal function, electrolyte imbalances

description_processed.orig: Digoxin can be harmful if too much is taken. Your prescriber will monitor your blood to make sure you have the correct amount in your body. If you or your caregivers/family notice nausea, vomiting, changes in vision or inability to eat, let your doctor know as soon as possible.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in thyroid medications
risks_warnings.description: Digoxin can have increased or decreased effects if you have thyroid problems. Tell your doctor if you have problems with your thyroid as they may have to adjust your medications.

description_processed.orig: Digoxin can have increased or decreased effects if you have thyroid problems. Tell your doctor if you have problems with your thyroid as they may have to adjust your medications.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: People on the 0.125 mg strength of Digoxin can develop an allergic reaction, especially if you have an allergy to aspirin. Tell your prescriber if you are allergic to aspirin.

description_processed.orig: People on the 0.125 mg strength of Digoxin can develop an allergic reaction, especially if you have an allergy to aspirin. Tell your prescriber if you are allergic to aspirin.

risks_warnings.title: Heart rhythm problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Digoxin before fixing your heart rhythm by doing an electrocardioversion may increase your risk for changes in your heartbeat called ventricular fibrillation. Tell your doctor if you are taking Digoxin if they are considering this procedure.

description_processed.orig: Taking Digoxin before fixing your heart rhythm by doing an electrocardioversion may increase your risk for changes in your heartbeat called ventricular fibrillation. Tell your doctor if you are taking Digoxin if they are considering this procedure.

points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)

carousel_items: Take it with food.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and headache.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
This is the immediate release version. It also comes as an extended release form: Toprol XL (metoprolol succinate).

clock.tip: Works better if taken with food.
Works better if taken with food.
Works better if taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Metoprolol tartrate is a beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Metoprolol tartrate is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Metoprolol tartrate suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Metoprolol tartrate suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina). Makes pain attacks less frequent and makes it easier to be active without having chest pain.
A first-choice treatment for heart failure. May prevent long-term heart damage.
A first-choice treatment for heart attack. Lowers the risk of death during and after a heart attack.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina). Makes pain attacks less frequent and makes it easier to be active without having chest pain.
A first-choice treatment for heart failure. May prevent long-term heart damage.
A first-choice treatment for heart attack. Lowers the risk of death during and after a heart attack.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: it's never given me any problems or dramatic side effects.

Had to try different Metoprolol dosages and then also added Losartan to finally settle on a regime that has kept my blood pressure under control and stable for over 10 years with little side effects. Definitely worth it.
userStories.identifier: HBP and mild heart attack 15 years ago.

userStories.tip: I don't like the fatigue it causes. I've been taking this medication for 6 weeks and it's difficult for me to work out. I do not have the endurance I had before starting this medication. It makes me sluggish and tired.
Schedule dosage at well before activity.  Will sometimes cause drowsiness within an hour for about a half an hour

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Metoprolol tartrate.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Metoprolol tartrate.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Increased symptoms of heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Metoprolol tartrate. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

description_processed.orig: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Metoprolol tartrate. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Metoprolol tartrate, so they can monitor your heart closely.

description_processed.orig: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Metoprolol tartrate, so they can monitor your heart closely.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Metoprolol tartrate has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Metoprolol tartrate should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Metoprolol tartrate has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Metoprolol tartrate should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

carousel_items: Your doctor may have you start taking Amiodarone in a hospital or clinic so you can be watched closely for side effects.
It can take 1 or 2 weeks before you start to see any effects.
There are many serious side effects that can only be found by getting blood tests done. It's important to follow all of your doctor's instructions when taking Amiodarone.
Can make your skin more sensitive to sun. Use proper protection, such as sunscreen, and avoid sun lamps.
Can cause nausea, so you can take it with food to help.
Drinking grapefruit juice with Amiodarone can affect your heart rate, so avoid all forms of grapefruits.

basics.benefits_moa: Amiodarone is an anti-arrhythmic medicine. It treats heart rate problems by blocking rogue electrical signals in your heart.
basics.bottom_line: Amiodarone is an option to treat heart rate problems when other medicines don't work, but it can take a few weeks to work and there's a lot of serious side effects.
downsides: Not a good choice if you have eye, liver, or lung problems.
You'll need regular monitoring for side effects, such as routine blood tests, heart tests, and eye exams.
Amiodarone can stay in your body for weeks or months after you've stopped taking it. Make sure you tell your doctor or dentist that you've taken Amiodarone if they don't already know.
There are many possible drug interactions, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before making any changes or starting a new medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a good choice if you have eye, liver, or lung problems.
You'll need regular monitoring for side effects, such as routine blood tests, heart tests, and eye exams.
Amiodarone can stay in your body for weeks or months after you've stopped taking it. Make sure you tell your doctor or dentist that you've taken Amiodarone if they don't already know.
There are many possible drug interactions, so talk to your doctor or pharmacist before making any changes or starting a new medicine.

upsides: An option for treating life-threatening heart rate problems when other medicines or procedures haven't worked.
Amiodarone has been shown to lower the number of heart rate problems you can experience after certain types of heart surgeries.
Available as a generic version, so it should be affordable.

upsides_processed.orig: An option for treating life-threatening heart rate problems when other medicines or procedures haven't worked.
Amiodarone has been shown to lower the number of heart rate problems you can experience after certain types of heart surgeries.
Available as a generic version, so it should be affordable.

userStories.tip: Take the loading dose (several weeks) alone so if you vomit 20 minutes later, you only lose one drug, not your entire regimen. 800mg is hard for me to keep down. Maintenance dose (after 2 weeks) is a piece of cake.

drugs.name: Amiodarone

Can make your skin more sensitive to sun. Use proper protection, such as sunscreen, and avoid sun lamps.
Can cause nausea, so you can take it with food to help.
Drinking grapefruit juice with Amiodarone can affect your heart rate, so avoid all forms of grapefruits.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatening heart rate problems
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone should only be used in people with life-threatening heart rate problems. There are many potentially fatal side effects and it can make the heart rate problem worse or harder to handle. Other similar medicines should be tried first before Amiodarone. People can start taking Amiodarone in a hospital to watch for side effects.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone should only be used in people with life-threatening heart rate problems. There are many potentially fatal side effects and it can make the heart rate problem worse or harder to handle. Other similar medicines should be tried first before Amiodarone. People can start taking Amiodarone in a hospital to watch for side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Lung damage
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause serious lung problems, sometimes without any symptoms. Call your doctor immediately if you have any breathing problems, like shortness of breath, trouble breathing, or a cough. Baseline and follow-up lab tests, including chest x-rays every 3 to 6 months, are needed before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause serious lung problems, sometimes without any symptoms. Call your doctor immediately if you have any breathing problems, like shortness of breath, trouble breathing, or a cough. Baseline and follow-up lab tests, including chest x-rays every 3 to 6 months, are needed before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone is broken down by the liver. It can cause mild liver problems, but in some cases, it can cause severe problems. Call your doctor immediately if you have dark urine or light-colored stool, yellow skin or eyes, stomach pain, or feel tired or not hungry. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone is broken down by the liver. It can cause mild liver problems, but in some cases, it can cause severe problems. Call your doctor immediately if you have dark urine or light-colored stool, yellow skin or eyes, stomach pain, or feel tired or not hungry. If you have liver problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Vision problems
risks_warnings.description: Vision problems, such as blurred vision, decreased peripheral vision, or visual halos, can occur. Talk to your doctor if you experience any vision impairment and make sure you have regular eye exams every 6 months.

description_processed.orig: Vision problems, such as blurred vision, decreased peripheral vision, or visual halos, can occur. Talk to your doctor if you experience any vision impairment and make sure you have regular eye exams every 6 months.

risks_warnings.title: Thyroid problems
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause low or high levels of thyroid hormone. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of thyroid problems or are taking thyroid medicine. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed every 6 months before starting Amiodarone.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause low or high levels of thyroid hormone. Talk to your doctor if you have a history of thyroid problems or are taking thyroid medicine. Baseline and follow-up lab tests are needed every 6 months before starting Amiodarone.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Amiodarone can cause birth defects. Don't use Amiodarone while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Amiodarone can cause birth defects. Don't use Amiodarone while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.
